...blood vomiting, not making a sound, I would endure.

text: Ya Turgut Alp, obama gelmeye razı olur mu?
english: What about Turgut Alp, would he be willing to come to Obama?
Ertuğrul has spoken to Mr Turgut.

text: O da senin gibi obalarımızın iyiliğini düşünen fedakâr bir yiğittir.
english: He's a self-sacrificing hero like you, who cares for the welfare of our villages.

text: Çavdar Obası'nda yaşamaya da razı gelmiştir.
english: He's also agreed to live in the Chowdar House.

text: Böyle bir fedakârlık her yiğidin harcı değildir.
english: Such a sacrifice is not a waste of every brave man.

text: Bundan sebep Ertuğrul Bey sizi birbirinize münasip görmüştür.
english: That's why Mr. Ertuğrul has found you fit.

text: Sen de, o da aynı davayı sahiplenen...
english: And you, who owns the same case...
...you're the only people in the village who are worried.
...there is no other way out of this holy road.
(Laughter) The key to marriage is sacrifice.
If your love is nourished by sacrifice...
...you will have peace in your life.
All I want is peace, mother.

text: Turgut Alp yiğittir, merttir. Ağabeyimle sırt sırta cenk etmiştir.
english: Turgut Alp is brave, brave, he fought my brother back to back.
Ertugrul Beyzin's companion is not hurt.

text: Bundan sebep biz de deriz ki Aslıhan Hatun, düşünüp taşınasın.
english: That's why we say, "Aslihan Khatun, think about it".

text: Eğer rızan olursa bu işi tamam edelim.
english: If you'll excuse us, let's finish this.

text: Düşünecek vakit yoktur Halime Sultan. Her gecemi kâbusla geçiririm.
english: I have no time to think, Halime Sultan.
Mr. Ertuğrul thought the right thing to do.

text: Turgut Alp obamda kalacak olduktan sonra da rızam vardır.
english: I'll have my consent after Turgut Alp is in my village.

text: O vakit kızım, sen de münasip görürsen bu akşam ziyaretine gelelim.
english: Then, my daughter, if you'd like, we'll come to visit you tonight.
We'll call you when we can.
Let us fulfill the requirements of our ritual, our faith.

text: Buyurun gelin ana. Otağıma şeref verirsiniz.
english: Here, bride, you will honor my room.
Let's get back to Abdurrahman and his wife.
Let Ertuğrul Bey's hand over this to you.
Let's see, give us a minute.

text: Sultan müzakereler için Emir Sadeddin'i gönderecektir.
english: The Sultan will send Emir Sadeddin for the negotiations.
They're not gonna make it out of this castle alive.

text: Bir daha Ertuğrul’u bu kadar savunmasız yakalayamayız.
english: We can't catch Ertuğrul again so defenseless.

text: Ertuğrul’un da Emir Sadeddin'in de ölmesini senden çok ben isterim.
english: I would rather you die than Ertuğrul and Emir Sadeddin.

text: Bunu yaparsan sultan kaleyi başımıza yıkar.
english: If you do that, the sultan will destroy the castle.
What are you gonna do when Ares comes?

text: Gerekirse onu da öldürürüm. Bu kalenin komutanı benim.
english: I'll kill him if I have to.
(Soldier) May I have a moment, sir?

text: Komutan Ares askerleriyle kaleye giriyor efendim.
english: Commander Ares is entering the fortress with his troops, sir.
Let's not keep our emperor's commander in chief waiting.
Sir, there's a little air conditioning from Hayme's mother.

text: Hayme Ana netice hayırdır, bu akşam misafir olacağınızı söyledi.
english: Hayme Ana says no, you're going to be a guest tonight.
We have a good job, Bams.
Who are we gonna step up to, sir?

text: Beyim. Beyim anlat hele. Nasıl oldu bu iş? Kimdir?
english: Sir, tell me, sir, how did this happen?

text: Bamsı, gel hele. Ben sana her şeyi anlatacağım.

english: You're the reason what happened to me.

text: Babasının rızasıyla verdiği sözü de bozdu.
english: And he broke his promise with his father's consent.
If Aslihan Hatun has made a decision...

text: Peki ya Candar Bey’in kararı, ha?

english: Why don't you follow a father's orders?
Why isn't he following my decision?

text: Olmuş bir işe neden çomak soktun Ertuğrul?
english: Why did you put a stunt on something that happened, Ertuğrul?

text: Emir Hazretleri, eğer başımıza gelen hadiseler yüzünden…
english: Your Highness, if the events that have befallen us...
...if we're going to take each other into account...

text: Senin bu işte bizzat dahlin var. Taammüden aklına girdin Aslıhan’ın.
english: You're very talented in this business, you've been thinking about it.
The key is to get into the heart of your loved one.

text: Ya, ya kardeş, anlatasın hele. Nasıl olacak o iş?
english: So, brother, tell me, how's that gonna work?

text: Bu kimdir, bu? Nedir? Bizim obadan mıdır?
english: Who is this, what is this, from our village?

text: Başka obadan mıdır? Irak mıdır, yakın mıdır?
english: Is he from another village, Iraq or nearby?

text: Ya diyesin hele. Anlatsana. Susmasana kardeş.
english: Tell me, brother, what's the matter?

text: Ya bir susmadın ki anlatayım Bamsı.
english: Or you didn't shut up, so I'll tell you, Bams.

text: Haa. Ya kardeş, ben telaştan ne ettiğimi mi bilirim?
english: What about me, brother, do I know what I'm doing?

text: Ya kardeş, kardeş, anlatasın hele. Kimdir? Susmayasın.
english: And brother, brother, tell me who he is.
The part that Ertuğrul Beyjiim considers appropriate...

text: Kardeş, benim kulaklarım doğru mu işitir?
english: Brother, do my ears hear right?

text: Ya kardeş, Aslıhan Hatun, Emir Sadeddin’le sözlü değil midir?
english: And brother, Aslihan Khatun, is he not speaking to Emir Sadeddin?
He said he'd never leave his pack.
He promised to the merciful Aliyar.

text: Eh tabii Emir Sadeddin de onu obadan götürecek.
english: Well, of course Emir Sadeddin will take him out of the village.
Aslihan Hatun doesn't want to either.

text: Ertuğrul Bey’im de Çavdar Obası'nın istikbali için…
english: Ertugrul Beyim also for the stability of the Chowdar Housing...
The order falls from the side of Sadeddin...

text: …iki oba arasında kan bağı kurulsun diye de benimle evlendirmek ister.
english: ...and wants to marry me so that the blood bond between the two villages can be established.

text: Sen bu dağların ayısına koca cihanı bahşettin kardeş.
english: You gave this mountain bear a big bowl, brother.

text: Hele bir dur Bamsı. Daha kızı istemedik. Kız he demedi daha.
english: We didn't want the girl yet, she didn't say he.

text: Ya kardeş, o nasıl söz? Senden âlâ er mi vardır?
english: And what is that, brother? Is there a man more than you?

text: Kardeş, Aslıhan Hatun sana, sen Aslıhan Hatun’a yakışırsın.
english: Brother, Aslihan Hatun is for you, you are aslihan Hatun.

text: Allah tamam etsin, hayır etsin. Hay maşallah.
english: God bless you, God bless you, God bless you.
I'm going to be a little late.

text: …madem kız istemeye gideceğiz hadi kalk, kalk, kalk. Hazırlanalım.
english: We're going to get a girl.
- You're a brother, you're a brother.

text: Ya kardeş, önce sana bir çekidüzen vermek gerekir.
english: Brother, I need to give you a shot first.

text: Eh, önce de şu saçlarını yola koyarak başlayalım işe.
english: Well, let's get started by putting your hair on the road.

text: Görmez misin? Saçının bir tarafı Fizan’a, bir tarafı Umman’a gider.
english: Don't you see, one side of your hair goes to Fizan, one side to Umman.
I'll take care of it, I'll take care of it.

text: Emir Sadeddin, Ertuğrul Bey. Sultanımız sizi görmek ister.
english: Emir Sadeddin, Lord Ertuğrul, our Sultan wants to see you.
Nice is the air I've been waiting for.

text: Eyyubi ordusu sınırlarımıza doğru harekete geçmiştir.
english: Job's army has moved towards our borders.

text: …Moğollara arayıp da bulamadıkları imkânı verecektir Sultanım.
english: ...will allow the Mongols to search and find nowhere.

text: Ögeday’ın dağınık birlikleri bu imkânı fırsat bilip…
english: The disorganized troops of the Oegedai knew this opportunity...
The Mongol pioneering troops are on our borders...
...you were the first to breastfeed, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: (Alaeddin) Sen de onları iyi tanırsın. Sözlerin doğrudur.
english: And thou knowest them well; thy word is true.

text: Zayıf anımızı bulduklarında birlikleriyle talana değil…
english: Not to be a thief with his troops when they find our weak moment...
...and they will come to destroy my country.

text: Gayrı ordumuzla birlikte sefere çıkmak mecburiyetindeyiz.
english: We must go out with our non-commissioned army.
It's not about the war, Emir Sadeddin.
When the time for the Job comes...
...who will take his share of my sword like my enemies.

text: Mesele İslam âleminin içine düştüğü ahvaldir.
english: It's like the Islamic world is falling apart.

text: Sadece İslam devletleri değil, en küçük emirlikler bile…
english: Not only Islamic states, but even the smallest orders...
...they have fallen into each other's throats with their unquenchable lust.
...the Mongols on the one hand, the Crusaders on the other...
...they will not stop at their side, my Sultan.

text: İslam’ın adalet sancağını yere düşürmeyeceğiz Ertuğrul Bey.
english: We will not bring down the belief of Islam in justice, Mr. Ertuğrul.
...this flag will be waved with dignity.

text: Moğolların da, Haçlıların da bu zulmüne dur diyecek olan…
english: The one who will say to the Mongols and the Crusaders, stop this oppression...
...to fight under the banner of Islam.
Just because our state is a...

text: …beylerimiz senin kadar cesur ve adaletli ola.
english: ...that our children may be as brave and just as you are.

text: Azıcık daha çabaladık mı oldu bu iş.
english: We've tried a little harder, and it's done.
You're a little bit of a bitch.

text: Cenge gider gibi değil de kız istemeye gider gibi oldun.
english: You're not going to war, you're going to want a girl.
Why do you say that, brother?

text: Bende işe yaradıydı. Hafsa Hatun beni böyle beğendiydi.
english: I was like, "Hafsa Hatun likes me like that".
It's not the head, it's the hair, brother.
Hafsa Hatun has loved your heart.

text: İyi. Öyle dersin değil mi kardeş?
english: That's what you're saying, isn't it, brother?
They say it's a burn, it's a sticky hair.

text: Hem kardeş, Aslıhan Hatun seni böyle görünce…
english: And brother, when Aslihan Khatun sees you like this...
...you'll be shot like a lightning strike.
It's clear he'll be back in the blink of an eye.
Brother, we haven't dressed you yet.
Let's get dressed and surround you.

text: Hah. Kardeş, sen bununla kışlak yere göçe mi gidersin?
english: Brother, would you move to a shelter with this?

text: Azıcık daha ince bir gömlek giyesin üstüne.
english: Put a thinner shirt on it.
Let it go, brother, let it go.
What am I supposed to wear?
My Sultan, the Artuk Lord is here.
Sultan, I have arrived at Karacahisar Castle on your orders.

text: İmparator tam yetkiyle bir komutan göndermiştir.
english: The Emperor has sent a commander with full authority.

text: Yarın sulh müzakereleri için kaleye elçilerinizi davet ederler.
english: They'll invite your ambassadors to the fort tomorrow for peace talks.
You have honored our pen, Commander Ares.

text: Sen bir asker için şeref nedir bilir misin Nikolas?
english: You know what honor is for a soldier, Nikolas?
I heard you left Vasilius to die.
When Vasilius fell into the trap of Ertuğrul...
...I could not leave the castle defenseless, sir.
I live to die with my honor.

text: Eğer bir hatam varsa bedelini ödemeye hazırım.
english: If I'm wrong, I'm willing to pay the price.

text: O bedeli Vasilius kanıyla ödedi Nikolas.
english: That price was paid by the blood of Vasilius, Nicholas.

text: Sizin için, imparatorumuz için ölmeye hazırım.
english: I am willing to die for you, for our emperor.

text: Komutanı olmayan bir kale, taştan bir harabeden farksızdır.
english: A castle without a commander is no different from a stone castle.
If a wreck with a commander...
...more powerful than the walls of Byzantium.
Who left his commander to die...
...and he has given the castle to the enemy.

text: Şimdi bu sadakatsiz adamın leşini buradan kaldırın.
english: Now get this unfaithful man's body out of here.

text: İmparatorumuz için ölen askerlerin anısını daha fazla kirletmesin.
english: Let him not pollute the memory of the soldiers who died for our emperor any more.
Come with me, we have to talk.
My Sultan, the Emperor will not surrender the castle...
...seems to be willing to make a deal.

text: Belli ki ağır şartları dahi kabul edecektir.
english: He'll obviously accept the harsh conditions.
My Sultan, perhaps this is better.

text: Vasilius’un ölümü, sizin burada, ordunuzun yolda olması…
english: The death of Vasilius, the fact that you are here, your army is on the way...

text: Kaleden akan cerahati dağlamanın tam vaktidir.
english: It's time to dismantle the flowing water from the castle.

text: …en ağır şartlarla onları sulha ikna etmek en doğrusu olacaktır.
english: ...and under the most severe conditions, it would be best to convince them to reconcile.

text: Sultanım, ordumuzun Eyyubiler üzerine sefere çıkacağı bu çetin günlerde…
english: My Sultan, in these difficult days when our army is marching on the Jobites...

text: …bir tek askerimize dahi zeval gelmeden zafer kazanabiliriz.
english: ...we can win without even a single soldier coming down.
Especially the heavy taxes we're gonna charge them...
...to be used to advance our state.
My Sultan, gold will not stop this misfortune.

text: Karacahisar Kalesi onların himayesinde olduğu müddetçe…
english: As long as they have the protection of Karacahisar Castle...

text: Bu şerrin kökünü kazımadıkça içimiz rahat etmeyecektir.
english: Unless we root out this evil, we will not rest.

text: Elzem olan, Eyyubilerin tecavüzüne mani olmaktır.
english: The only thing I need is to stop the rape of the Jobites.

text: Sultanım, ordumuzu bölersek iki cenkte de muvaffak olamayız.
english: My Sultan, if we divide our army, we cannot succeed in both wars.

text: Emir Sadeddin’in dediği ağır vergilere razı gelirsek…
english: If we agree to the heavy taxes that Emir Sadeddin Khan has called...

text: …onlara güçlenmeleri için vakit vermiş oluruz Sultanım.
english: ...we will have given them time to strengthen themselves, Sultan.

text: Yaralarını sarmalarına izin vermeyeceğiz Ertuğrul Bey.
english: We will not let them wrap their wounds, Mr. Ertuğrul.
You'll keep them from getting stronger.
I have not trusted the mighty Alps.
We'll take the deal for now.
And when the time comes, we'll clear the swamp.

text: Emriniz üzerine kaleye varıp layıkıyla bir anlaşma yapmak isterim Sultanım.
english: I would like to reach the castle on your orders and make a deal worthy of your honour, Sultan.

text: O vakit bu anlaşma vergiyle sınırlı kalmamalı diye düşünürüm Sultanım.
english: Then I think this deal should not be limited to taxes, Sultan.

text: İmparatora o topraklarda bizim iznimiz olmadan…
english: The Emperor is in those lands without our permission...
...it's funny that we tell you you can't even breathe.

text: Müsaade ederseniz uçbeyiniz olarak kaleye ben de varmak isterim.
english: I'd like to get to the castle as your pilot, if you'll excuse me.

text: Her ikinizin de bu vazifeyi hakkıyla yerine getireceğinden şüphem yoktur.
english: I have no doubt that you will both do this duty well.

text: Ya kardeş, seni gören hatun aha da böyle katır tepmişe döner.
english: Oh, brother, the girl who sees you, ah, she'll be so hard on you.

text: Böyle yüreği kuş gibi pırpır eder.
english: It makes her heart flutter like a bird.

text: Kardeş, yağız at gibi böyle yaylalarda koşmak ister.
english: Brother wants to run on slopes like a fat horse.

text: Kardeş, hani dediydim ya sana katır tepmişe dönerler diye…
english: Brother, I told you, or they'd come back to you...

text: Ya Günkut kardeş, ne bakarsın öyle tilki görmüş tavşan gibi?
english: What about Brother Gunkut, what do you look like a rabbit that saw a fox?
I'll take care of my Turgut Alpshis, brother.
You're not looking, you're just a little bit of a pain.

text: Haa. Dumrul kardeşe de maşallah dediydin sultanımız gibi giyindiğinde.
english: You called Dumrul brother Machallah when he dressed like our sultan.

text: Ertuğrul Bey’im tez yola düşeceğiz der.
english: Ertugrul Beyim says we will leave soon.

text: Hadi bakalım. Hadi kardeş, gazan mübarek olsun.
english: Come on, brother, bless the cow.
You saved our country from a great disaster.

text: Nikolas sizi öldürseydi anlaşmak için kaleye gelen Türkleri de öldürecekti.
english: If Nicholas had killed you, he would have killed the Turks who came to the castle to make a deal.
You should have known I wouldn't let that happen.
The letter said you'd be here tomorrow.

text: Erken gelmeniz, olacaklara ne kadar hâkim olduğunuzu gösterir.
english: Your early arrival shows how much control you have over what's going to happen.

text: Onun yüzünden sultanın ordusu ve Türk obaları bir olup kaleyi yağmalayacaktı.
english: Because of him, the Sultan's army and the Turkish villages would be destroyed and the castle would be plundered.

text: Ve sen de imparatorun verdiği bütün imtiyazları kaybedecektin.
english: And you would lose all the privileges the emperor gave you.

text: Ertuğrul sahip olduğum her şeyi benden aldı.
english: Ertuğrul took everything I had from me.

text: Onun ölmesini ve Türk obalarının geldikleri cehenneme geri dönmesini…
english: That he should die and return to the hell his Turkish villages came from...
...no one wants it as much as I do.

text: Ben imparatorumuz için ölmeye yemin ettim.
english: I swore to die for our emperor.
By paying them a heavy tax...
You don't think he's going to get revenge, do you, Ekaterina?

text: Tek bildiğim, Türklerin kana asla doymayacağıdır.
english: All I know is that the Turks will never get enough blood.

text: Ne imparatorumuzun ne de sizin gibi güçlü bir komutanın…
english: Neither our emperor nor a powerful commander like you...
I never thought you'd get away with it.

text: Vasilius’un sana neden bu kadar çok itibar ettiğini...
english: Why did Vasilius have such respect for you?
I understand it much better now.
I carry the fruit of love in my belly.

text: İmparatorumuz için canım da, evladım da fedadır.
english: My life and my son are sacrifices to our emperor.
You have impressed our emperor with your letter, Ekaterina.

text: Türkleri topraklarımızdan ancak senin yardımınla atabileceğimize…
english: We can only get rid of the Turks from our land with your help...

text: Devletimiz için, babamın bu kutsal mirası için…
english: For our country, for this sacred legacy of my father...

text: Ben de vakti geldiğinde zehirli hançerini Türklerin kalbine…
english: And when the time came, I put a poison knife in the hearts of the Turks...

text: …saplayacak kadar cesur olduğuna inanmak isterim Ekaterina.
english: I'd like to believe that you're brave enough to be a witch, Ekaterina.
Believe me, this is Commander Ares.

text: Siz topraklarımızı Türklerle paylaşmak zorunda kalan halkımızın son umudusunuz.
english: You are the last hope of our people who have to share our land with the Turks.

text: Ertuğrul. Onu öldürmek hiç de kolay değil.
english: It's not easy to kill him.

text: Ertuğrul başta olmak üzere düşmanlarım hakkında her şeyi bilirim.
english: I know everything about my enemies, including Ertugrul.

text: Hem de tahmin ettiğinden çok daha fazlasını.
english: And much more than you thought.

text: Gözüm üzerinde olacak Ekaterina. Neler yapabildiğini göreceğim.
english: I'll keep an eye on you, Ekaterina, see what you can do.
I have some things I need to talk to my commander.
...from the cowardly fear of my enemy...
...beware of the betrayal of the seemingly friendly.

text: Bana Türklere karşı mağlup olarak değil…
english: I don't think of myself as a defeated Turk.
...give me the strength to die with victory.
You have honored my room, Mr. Ertuğrul.
It's very nice of you, Mother.
I'm going to take care of it.

text: Sen de hoş gelmişsin Turgut Alp.
english: You're a nice guy, too, Turgut Alp.

text: Buyurun. Yoldan geldiniz. İki lokma yiyip soluklanın.
english: Here you are, come on, two loafs and breathe.
By Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
By Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
By Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
...and we shared our laughs and our dreams.

text: İki oba arasında kuvvetli bir bağ kurduk.
english: We have established a strong bond between the two villages.

text: İmdi isterim ki bu bağ, kan bağıyla daha da pekişsin…
english: Now I want you to strengthen this bond with the blood bond...

text: Hayırla gelenin başımızın üstünde yeri vardır Ertuğrul Bey’im.
english: The one who comes with good has a place above us, My Lord Ertuğrul.
I hope we get out of your room with good luck.

text: Bir yanda Aliyar Bey’imin bana bıraktığı emanet…
english: On the one hand, the trust that Aliyar Bey left me...
...and on the other side, our villages have a ikbali.
Aslihan Hatun, I would like you to...
...you'll be in the same boat as the Turgut Alp.

text: Gönlünden ne geçerse çekinmeden bana diyesin Aslıhan Hatun.
english: Whatever you want to say, tell me without hesitation.

text: Bir gayem vardır, o da obama ve abimin emanetine sahip çıkmaktır.
english: There's one thing I can do, and that's take the trust of Obama and my brother.
By God's grace, to celebrate my room with my children...
...to bend my waist and rob my offspring.

text: Senin diyeceğin var mıdır Turgut Alp’im?
english: Do you have anything to say about Turgut Alpim?

text: Aliyar Bey’le nice cenge beraber girdik.
english: We have fought many wars together with the Allies.

text: Çavdar Obasının yiğit Alpleriyle hiçbir vakit düşmana aman vermedik.
english: We have never given up on the enemy with the brave Alps of the Cradle.

text: Hepimiz için mühim olan gaza, cihat yolundan ayrılmamaktı.
english: The most important thing for all of us was to keep the gas on the jihadist path.
And the Sculpture House is my home...
...and the Guard House is my home.
To dedicate your life to your son, your home, your girl...

text: Obama ömrünü verene, ömrüm fedadır Ertuğrul Bey’im.
english: My life is a sacrifice to the one who gave Obama his life, Mr. Ertuğrul.
By Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

text: Ertuğrul Bey ve Alplerine saldıran okçular.
english: The archers who attacked Mr. Ertuğrul and the Alps.
We're trying to get information, but it's hard.

text: Ya devletimizin damarlarına zehir gibi sızan bu hainler…
english: What about these traitors who leak poison into the veins of our state...

text: Nizamı korumak, devleti baki kılmak bizim asli görevimizdir Sultanım.
english: It is our duty to maintain order, to maintain the state, Sultan.

text: Seferden döner dönmez saraydaki tedbirleri arttıracağım inşallah.
english: I hope to increase the measures at the palace as soon as I return from the trip.

text: Siz seferdeyken Moğolların rahat durmayacağı aşikâr.
english: It's obvious that the Mongols won't be comfortable with you on the move.
I need to be careful with them.

text: Hakkını teslim etmeliyim, Ertuğrul Bey bu iş için biçilmiş kaftandır.
english: I must surrender your right, Mr. Ertuğrul is a cut-throat for this job.

text: Moğollarla hepimizden uzun vakit cenk etti.
english: He fought the Mongols longer than all of us.

text: Noyan gibi bir belayı başımızdan defetti.
english: A noyan-like mess has gone off our heads.

text: …onların dilinden en iyi anlayan uçbeyi, Ertuğrul Bey’dir.
english: ...they have the best understanding of their language, Ertuğrul Bey.
You're right, Sadeddin, you are right.
But in the absence of Ertuğrul Bey...

text: …batı sınırımızda zafiyet baş göstermesinden endişe ederim.
english: I'm concerned that there's a buildup of violence on our western border.

text: O vakit müsaade buyurursanız ben burada kalıp…
english: Then if you'll excuse me, I'll stay here and...
...to try to serve you from here.
I hope I don't go looking for Ertuğrul Bey.

text: Yarın bu meseleyi Ertuğrul Bey’le istişare edeceğim.
english: I'll talk to Ertuğrul Bey on this tomorrow.

text: Zira Türk obalarının birliği ve huzuru elzemdir.
english: Because the unity and peace of the Turkish villages is essential.

text: Aslıhan Hatun’un da neden obası başında kalması gerektiğini anlamışsındır.
english: You must understand why Aslihan Hatun should stay in charge of his village.

text: Aslıhan Hatun gayet tabii olarak obasının başında kalıp…
english: Aslihan Hatun is naturally at the head of his village and...

text: …Candar Bey’den geçen son kanı korumak ister.
english: ...which he wants to preserve the last blood that passed from Mr. Candar.
It's a hope for his family.

text: Sakın ola bu umudu onlardan almayasın Sadeddin.
english: Don't take that hope away from them, Sadeddin.

text: Devletimiz için bu fedakârlığı yapacağından hiç şüphem yoktur.
english: I have no doubt that he will make this sacrifice for our country.
Aslihan, sister, we have made our promise.
(Sighs) We're not broken, we're not hurt.
By the command of God, the prophet to the people of our lord...
I would like to marry you to Turgut Alpim.

text: Sana da, Turgut Alp’e de itimadım tamdır Ertuğrul Bey’im.
english: I didn't believe you or Turgut Alp, exactly, Mr Ertuğrul.
May God not let your peace be lacking.

text: Sizi dininize, törenize, obanıza bağlı evlatlar şenlendirsin.
english: Let your religion, your ritual, your father's children celebrate you.
I'm going to be a little late.
I'm going to be a little late.
Your height be painted, your lineage be stripped.

text: Bilinsin ki her kimin otağınıza kem gözü değse…
english: I want you to know that if anyone touches your room...
If the sentence gets to you...
...and he will receive his share of my wrath.
I want your soon-to-be marriage annulled.

text: İsterim ki bu nikâh kem gözlere perde, otağınıza kalkan olsun.
english: I want this wedding to be a blindfold, a shield to your room.

text: Mutluluğunuz da, soyunuz da daim olsun.
english: May your happiness and your descendants last forever.
- I'm going to be a little late.
I'm going to be a little late.

text: Gayrı sizin sözlünüz olan Aslıhan değil…
english: It's not Aslihan who's your spokesman...
I made my promise to you.
(Sighs) My destiny is to grow old and die in my village.
...you threw me into the hell of love.

text: Emir Hazretleri, Aslıhan Hatun’dan malumat vardır.
english: There is information from His Highness, Aslihan Hatun.

text: Ertuğrul Bey, Hayme Hatun, Halime Hatun ve Turgut Alp…
english: Ertugrul Bey, Hayme Hatun, Halime Hatun and Turgut Alp...
...was a guest in the Guard Room.
Go on, get out of here.
You'll go with your games, your troubles.
When you go on a trip...
My fight is about to begin.

text: Kardeşler, Turgut kardeşin hayırlı işi hepimizi bahtiyar etmiştir.
english: Brothers, the good work of Brother Turgut has blessed us all.

text: Ben de kardeşim namına size ziyafet vereyim dedim.
english: I thought I'd give you a feast in my brother's name.

text: Hafsa'm kendi elleriyle mis gibi aş yapmıştır.
english: My Hafsa has cooked with her own hands like copper.
We eat grass like goats, grass.
Don't worry about your hands, Hafsa Hatun.

text: Ya, ya kardeşler hele, hele bir yiyesiniz.
english: Oh, my brothers, you're a meal.
You'll be in class after that.

text: Gönül isterdi ki size balık pişireyim.
english: He'd like me to cook you fish.
But it's hard to find here.
We eat what God has given us.
At Nikea, we used to decorate our dining room with all sorts of weeds.

text: (Hafsa) Hem lezzetlidir hem de hazmı kolaydır.
english: (Praying) It's both delicious and easy to digest.
I put a lot of spices in the bag.
By Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

text: Ben hayatımda hiç böyle güzel yahni yemedim.
english: I've never had a nice egg in my life.

text: Vallahi kardeş biz imdiye dek ne yermişiz ya?
english: What did we eat before we got here?
I'll take a look at a Flower Banjo.
You'll make up for the shortcomings.
I, I'll take care of my brothers.

text: Ee, kardeş, benim boğazım malumunuzdur, bana da böylesi gerektir.
english: Well, brother, you know my throat, and I need it.

text: Hele bu otlardan yapılan aş bambaşkadır kardeş.
english: Especially the food made from these herbs is different, brother.

text: He ya, keçi yerdi, yüzüne bile bakmazdık.
english: He was eating goats, we wouldn't even look at his face.

text: Senin de keçiden kalır yanın yok ya Günkut kardeş.
english: You're not going to get the goat, you Gunkut brother.

text: Ya kardeşler, Allah insanı çeşit çeşit yaratmıştır.
english: My brothers, God has created man in various ways.

text: Her milletin kendine has aşı, kendine has ekmeği vardır.
english: Every nation has its own vaccine, its own bread.

text: Kardeşler, bunları bilmek gerekir, bellemek gerekir.
english: Brothers, these things must be known, celebrated.
What did Turgut Alp Chief do?
I hope the matter is settled.

text: Ya kardeş, Ertuğrul Bey'imizin olduğu yerde hayırsız iş mi çıkar?
english: What about brother, is there no good in the place where our Lord Ertuğrul is?
Now we have one thing left to do.
We're going to Karacahisar Castle, brother.
Or you'll eat like a goat.
You eat like a goat, Gunkut.

text: (Ares iç ses) Bir imparatorluk ancak bu kadar aşağılanabilirdi.
english: (Ares voices) An empire could only be so overwhelmed.

text: (Ares iç ses) Gözlerinizin önünde büyüyen ve güçlenen bir düşmanı...
english: (Ares inner voice) An enemy growing and growing before your eyes...

text: ...sıradan bir göçebe gibi görüp ciddiye almadınız.
(Ares iç ses) Hangisine daha kızgınım bilmiyorum.
english: (Ares voices) I don't know which one I'm more angry at.
...come and write with a love of victory.

text: Komutan Ares, Emir Sadeddin ve Ertuğrul Bey geldi efendim.
english: Commander Ares, Emir Sadeddin and Mr Ertuğrul are here, sir.
You are the order of the Sadeddin.
I've heard your name a lot, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Her ne kadar düşman olsak da özünde ikimiz de...
english: As much as we're enemies, the bottom line is that we're both...
...we are fighting for the same thing, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Ve ben düşmanın mert olanını daima saygıyla karşılarım.
english: And I will always respect the brave of the enemy.

text: İkimizin gayesi geceyle gündüz kadar farklıdır Ares.
english: The two of us are as different as night and day, Ares.
Justice is what you think is injustice.
And the oppression is under my feet.

text: Bak, ortak bir yanımız daha çıktı.
english: Look, we have one more thing in common.

text: Emir Sadeddin, Nikea'da sizden çok söz ediyorlar.
english: Emir Sadeddin, you are a very well-known subject in Nikea.
Your mind is full of languages.

text: O vakit buradan elim boş çıkmayacağımı da anlamışsındır.
english: Then you must have known I'm not leaving here empty handed.
There's no need for that, Ares.
I've been in this castle many times.
...to serve for the rest of my life...
...I broke my promise to Emir Sadeddin.
Strengthening our brotherhood with the clay village...

text: ...ve kan bağı kurmak maksadıyla da Turgut Alp'le izdivaca karar verdim.
english: ...and I decided to make a blood connection with Turgut Alp in a crowd.

text: Bu evlilik iki obanın hayrına olacaktır inşallah.
english: I hope this marriage is for the good of both of you.

text: Hayırlı uğurlu olsun inşallah Aslıhan Hatun.
english: I hope you have a good day, Aslihan Hatun.
You'll spread the word about this weather all over the village.

text: Herkes bilsin, gayri Turgut Alp benim sözlümdür.
english: I'm the one who's responsible for Turgut Alp.
(Saddaddin) We have a long way to go, and a lot of work to do.
We're here to hear Nikea's offer.
In the name of the Seljuk State, Emir Sadeddin...

text: ...Kayı Boyu Beyi ve Selçuklu Devleti Uç Beyi Ertuğrul Bey...
english: ...the head of the country and the head of the country, Mr. Ertuğrul...
...I will be your interlocutor in the negotiations on behalf of our emperor.

text: Ekaterina da imparatorumuzun verdiği imtiyazlarla görüşmelerde yer alacak.
english: Catherine will also be present at the conferences of the privileges granted by our emperor.
We're here to make a deal.

text: Neticesi iki taraf için de iyi olsun.
english: I hope it's good for both sides.

text: Teklifimiz, askerlerimizin ve askerlerinizin canını korumak üzeredir.
english: Our proposal is to protect the lives of our soldiers and your soldiers.

text: Nikea imparatoru sulh için bedel ödemeye hazırdır.
english: The Emperor of Nikea is willing to pay the price for peace.
The price our empire will pay to the Seljuk State...

text: Ve ayrıca ticaret yollarından pay verecektir.
english: And he'll also be contributing to the trade routes.

text: Savaş bitecek ve insanlarınız huzur içinde yaşayacak.
english: The war will end and your people will live in peace.
As long as the peace continues...
...these taxes will continue to be paid.

text: Nikea imparatorunun ne denli cömert olduğunu bilirim.
english: I know how generous the Emperor of Nicaea is.

text: Siz de Sultanımız Alaeddin Keykubat'ın ne kadar bağışlayıcı olduğunu bilin.
english: And you know how forgiving our Sultan Alaeddin Kaykubat is.
Your life will be forgiven in exchange for your taxes.
You will be allowed to live in your castle.
So we're on the same page.
What does that mean, Mr. Ertuğrul?

text: Siz bir avuç altınla anca Latinleri ikna edersiniz.
english: You'll convince the Latins with a handful of gold.

text: Kalenin kapıları tüm Türk ve Müslümanlara açık olacaktır.
english: The castle's doors will be open to all Turks and Muslims.

text: Kale ticaretinde Müslümanlardan vergi ya da faiz alınmayacaktır.
english: No taxes or interest will be charged on the Muslims in the fort trade.
...you will keep your troop number limited.
...the Seljuk State will be aware and guardian.

text: Siz buraya anlaşmaya değil, işkal etmeye gelmişsiniz.
english: You're not here to make a deal, you're here to work.
...do what you want, and you'll surrender the castle.
Or would you accept our offer...

text: Bize karar vermek için birkaç gün müsaade et.
english: Give us a few days to decide.
He thinks we're out of control, he's coming at us.

text: Eğer kaleyi elimizde tutmak istiyorsak zaten çaremiz yok.
english: If we want to keep the castle, we have no choice.
How are we gonna give all this stuff away?
We'll give it to Ekaterina first.

text: Amacın ne senin? Ne yapmaya çalışırsın?

english: We came here to make a deal.
I'll try to make a deal, Your Highness.
You didn't come to a deal or anything.
Your wishes are like taking a castle.

text: Niyetim tam olarak budur Emir Hazretleri.
english: That's exactly what I intend, Your Highness.
What if they don't accept Ertuğrul?

text: O vakit elimizdeki ganimetten de olacağız.
english: Then we'll be the spoils of war.
- Then our sultan comes with an army...

text: Sultanımızın ordusu doğuya Eyyubilerle savaşa gitmiyor mu?
english: Isn't our Sultan's army going east to fight the Ayyubids?

text: Ordularımızın sınırlarına doğru harekete geçtiğini zanneder.
english: He thinks he's moving towards our military borders.
If we only come back with gold...

text: Bu iş senin yüzünden, senin inadın yüzünden mahvolursa...
english: If this business goes to waste because of you, because of your persistence...

text: Ben buraya çok ağır bedeller ödeyerek geldim Emir Sadeddin.
english: I came here paying a very heavy price, Emir Sadeddin.

text: İmdi de bunun karşılığını alma vaktidir.
english: Now is the time to pay for it.
I hope he gets a better reward.

text: İnşallah Turgut Alp'le Aslıhan'ın hayırlı işi tez vakitte tamamına erer.
english: I hope the good work of Turgut Alp and Aslihan is completed soon.

text: İkisi için de çok hayırlı olmuştur.
english: It's been good for both of them.

text: Turgut Alp ne vakittir içine çok kapanıktı.
english: Turgut Alp was so closed in.

text: İkisi de birbirine derman olacak inşallah.
english: I hope you'll both be together.
Love makes love beautiful, it makes it more humane.
Peace to your heart, prosperity to your chamber.
I hope the drought is over for all our single people.

text: Bamsı, Turgut Alp'i çok dert ederdi.
english: Her mother was very worried about Turgut Alp.
He would run away and go to her.
He wouldn't let her be alone.

text: Gayrı istese de çok sık yanına gidemez Hafsa.
english: He can't go to her very often, Hafsa.
Turgut Alp will settle in the Scavenger's Chamber.
The Sculpture Room is over there.

text: Hatunlar, bu iş bizim üzerimize çok büyük bir vazife yüklemiştir.
english: Ladies, this is a very big task for us.
We have a wedding, we have plenty of preparation.

text: Biz evlenirken nasıl yardımlaştığınızı gördüm ve çok imrendim.
english: I saw how you helped each other when we were married and I was amazed.

text: Çok şükür benim de yardım etme imkânım olacak.
english: Thank God I'll be able to help.
I hope we can handle this without any problems.

text: Herkes elinde, avucunda ne varsa döker.
english: Everyone spills what's in their hands.

text: Hatunlar, ben derim ki Aslıhan Hatun'un çeyizine de el atalım.
english: Ladies, I say we take the edge of Aslihan Khatun.
He's been through a lot of trouble.

text: Onca derdin arasında çeyiz görmeye vakti olmamıştır.
english: He didn't have time to see the grass in all the trouble.

text: Yanında olmamız dahi ona güç verecektir.
english: Even being with him will give him strength.

text: E haydi o vakit, çok işimiz vardır.
english: Well, then, we've got a lot to do.
- Oh, come on, you know what?

text: İstekleriniz imparatorluğumuzu madden ve manen yıpratacaktır. Ancak...
english: Your demands will destroy our empire in the face of material and material.
... our faith and support for peace is complete.
You got what you wanted, Mr. Ertuğrul.
Every single thing, one by one.

text: Ancak benim de bir talebim olacak.
english: But I'm going to have a request.
All you'll ask for is your life.
If you do what we say without contradicting...

text: Bu savaşta iki taraf da çok can kaybetti ama...
english: Both sides have lost a lot of lives in this war, but...

text: ...eğer bu anlaşma devam etmezse, o zaman...
english: ...if this deal doesn't go on, then...
...we're both going to lose so much more.
I want you to trust me.

text: Bugüne kadar kime düşmanlık ettiysen hepsi öldü.
english: Whoever you've been hostile to so far is dead.

text: Hepsi kılıçtan keskin bir şeyi hesaba katmadı.
english: Not all of them counted the sharpness of the sword.
I'm reaching out to you with a friendly hand.
...you live under the wrong flag, Ares.

text: ...ne de sizden olan hiç kimseye itimadım yoktur.
english: ...and I have not trusted any of you.
But you know what, I'm not gonna be a big shot.
...you'll find me in front of you.
The oppression is the armor of the cowards, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Ben bu dünyaya çıplak geldim, çıplak gideceğim.
english: I came into this world naked, I'm going to go naked.
To fulfill the terms of the agreement...
The order will be made, Emir Sadeddin.

text: Anlaşmanın şartları ve sizin ihtiyaçlarınızla şahsen ilgileneceğim.
english: I will take care of the terms of the agreement and your needs personally.

text: Vasilius seni hafife aldığı için bu haldeyiz Ertuğrul Bey.
english: We are in this situation because Vasilius took you lightly, Mr. Ertuğrul.
You can be sure I won't make the same mistake.
This deal must be terminated immediately!

text: Yoksa buna daha ne kadar dayanırım bilmem!
english: I don't know how much longer I can take this!

text: Emir Sadeddin bile şartları kabul ettiğimize inanamadı.
english: Even Emir Sadeddin couldn't believe we accepted the terms.

text: Bu kadarı onlar için bile fazla.
Tek bir altın bile vermeden anlaşmayı bozacağız.
english: We'll break the deal without giving you a single gold.
So I won't go against you...

text: Lakin Ural abim seni de zehirledi.
english: But my brother in the Urals poisoned you too.

text: ...senin de bin bir emekle kurduğun obanı...
english: ...and the house you built with a thousand hard work...
For the unity of our villages...
I know I'd be behind this decision.

text: Büyük bir imtiyaz elde ettik Sultanım.
english: We have a great privilege, Sultan.

text: ...Ümmet-i Muhammed'in kanayan yarasına merhem olamaya yetmez Sadeddin.
english: ...the blood-stained wound of Muhammad's people is not enough to be an ointment, Sadeddin.

text: ...Allah'ın adaletini dağıtmak için cenk ederiz bilmez misin?
english: Do you not know that we will fight to destroy the justice of God?
...the first time we got into a difficult situation, the Emperor...

text: ...tüm cihan leş kargaları gibi bizim yara almamızı beklemektedir.
english: ...the whole world is waiting for us to get hurt like dead crows.
There is oppression in every corner of the world.

text: Doğuya olan seferiniz işte bu yüzden elzemdir Sultanım.
english: That's why your trip to the east is so exciting, Sultan.

text: Devletimizin kudreti Moğollara da, Eyyubilere de yeter.
english: The power of our state is enough for the Mongols and the Ayyub.

text: Allah seferinizde sizi muzaffer kılsın Sultanım.
english: May Allah grant you victory in your journey, my Sultan.
I want you to join the gas.

text: Eyyubilere karşı çıktığım seferde doğu sınırlarımın emniyetini almak için...
english: When I went against the Jobites to secure my eastern borders...

text: Ben Eyyubi belasıyla baş ederken sen de doğu sınırımızda...
english: While I'm dealing with Job's troubles, you're on our eastern border...
...you will prevent the Mongols from attacking you.
Your orders are upon me, Sultan.
We will not give them a way out.
But don't keep your eye on the back.
...Emir Sadiddin will be the ruler of this land.
Your order is in disrepute, Sultan.

text: Türk obalarına haber salıp en iyi Alpleri toplarım Sultanım.
english: I'll report to the Turkish villages and collect the best of the Alps, Sultan.

text: Sizin sancağınız altında cenk etmekten şeref duyacaklardır.
english: They'll be honored to fight under your guise.
By the loyalty of our heroes...
...and I have no doubt of his worth.
Our country will be glorified with these heroes.

text: Sen de tedbirini alıp, hazırlıklarını yapasın Ertuğrul Bey.
english: You take your precautions and prepare yourself, Mr. Ertuğrul.
He'll meet them tomorrow at the Wolf Hill...
...and we'll move eastward to our border.

text: ...devletim için ne kadar isabetli bir karar aldığımı görürüm.
english: ...to see how decisive I am for my country.

text: Kılıcın kadar aklın da keskin olsun.
english: Be as sharp in mind as your sword.
I'm going to be a little late.
God forbid you should be ashamed.

text: ...toy da senin, gaza da senin olsun.

english: I will never forget this day.

text: Bir komutanın ahmaklığı yüzünden verdiğimiz imtiyazlar...
english: The privileges we give to a commander because of his stupidity...

text: Bunlara sebep olanlar artık toprağın altında.
english: The ones that caused this are now underground.

text: Ancak biz bu eziyete katlanmak zorundayız.
english: But we must endure this persecution.
The Turks have stopped for now, Ekaterina.

text: İmparatorun seni bir görev için seçti.
english: Your emperor has chosen you for a mission.

text: Ve hakların bu yüzden verildi, sakın unutma.
english: And that's why your rights were granted, remember.

text: Ertuğrul'un ölmesini isteyen sadece biz değiliz.
english: We're not the only ones who want Ertugrul dead.
We'll all work this out together.
Remember, if Ertugrul is not dead...

text: Korkacak ve kaybedecek hiçbir şeyim kalmadı.
english: I have nothing left to fear or lose.
The head of the mutiny at Karacahisar Castle has been cut off.
With the latest deal we made...
...we can't be hurt by Karachahisar again.

text: Allah seni başımızdan eksik etmesin beyim.
english: God forbid you should be cut off from us, sir.

text: Lakin imdi başımızda daha büyük bir mesele vardır.
english: But we have a bigger problem right now.
No, son, you just got here.
Who's left to stand up to you?

text: Ana, Eyyubiler ordusuyla sınırımıza hareket etmiştir.
english: Ana has moved to our border with the army of Job.
They threaten the integrity of our state.
Our sultan is out of town.
Our Sultan, as he went on the Jobites...
...and the Turkmen villages as a pioneering unit...

text: Biz devletimiz için her türlü zorluğa göğüs germeye ant içtik Halime Hatun.
english: We swore to stand up to any challenge for our country, Halime Hatun.

text: Günkut, Samsa, Dumrul, Abdurrahman'ı Türkmen obalarına yolla.
english: Send Günkut, Samsa, Dumrul, Abdurrahman to the villages of Turkmen.

text: Türk Beyleri en iyi Alplerini onların yanına versin.
english: Let the Turkish gentlemen give them their best Alps.
(Earthquake) You are in the Chamber of the Swallowers.

text: Aslıhan Hatun'un vereceği Alpleri yanına alasın.
english: Take the Alps that Aslihan Hatun will give you.
I'll meet you at Wolf Hill tomorrow.

text: Nikâhınızı da dönene dek ertelemek icap eder.
english: It's also inventive to postpone your wedding until you get back.
...and you'll come with me this time.
You're the one who orders it, sir.
I'd like to have your experience with me.
I'm a sacrifice to you, sir.
I wish I could have gone to war with you.
